Using Variables

To provide variables that are used in .twig.md files you can either provide global variables in source/outline.merge.json as variables, or you can generate them in a pre hook.

Global Static Variables

  1. Add something like the following to source/outline.merge.json:

    {
    "variables": {
        "website_url": "https://www.my-website.com",
        "author": "Aaron Klump"
    }
}

Dynamic During Compile

In a PHP pre hook file do something like:

$compiler->addVariables(['key' => 'value']);

Printing Variable Values

  1. Enable Twig rendering on the page where you want to use the variables by adding the file suffix .twig.md.
  2. Use Twig replacement syntax, e.g. {{ author }}.
